I will use Bayes' theorem to update the probability of the product being high-quality. Given that Alice recommended the product, I will assume that Alice's recommendation is based on the product's quality. If the product is high-quality, the probability of Alice recommending it is 1. If the product is low-quality, the probability of Alice recommending it is 0.5 (since she would recommend a low-quality product to 50% of the buyers). I will calculate the probability of the product being high-quality as follows: P(high-quality) = P(Alice recommends | high-quality) * P(high-quality) / P(Alice recommends). Since P(Alice recommends) = P(Alice recommends | high-quality) * P(high-quality) + P(Alice recommends | low-quality) * P(low-quality) = 1 * 0.3333 + 0.5 * 0.6667 = 0.5, we have P(high-quality) = 0.5 * 0.3333 / 0.5 = 0.1667. This means that the probability of the product being high-quality is approximately 16.67%. Given this low probability, I will choose to pass on the product.
